data.title: No selection highlighting in React Editor
data.body:
When highlighting lines in a react edtior, I don't get any highlighting. 
In fact, the only proof that anything's happening is that I see the position numbers in the gutter change, and I can copy paste that section which I can only surmise I selected.

As soon as I turn "Use React Editor" off, selection highlighting works again, so presumably it's not a theme issue?

data.title: Selections are hidden by tool panels
data.body:
New selections can be hidden behind tool panels. For example, when find and replace selects a match, but that match is located behind the find and replace panel, the editor doesn't scroll. The only way to view the selection is to manually scroll the editor or to close the find and replace view.

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/596/3237872/e8d636e0-f0ee-11e3-97e4-e2b0ad21e31f.gif)

data.title: Fix NPM verification failures after `script/clean` on Win32
data.body:
I think npm verification is failing unfairly on me when I try to build Atom on my Windows machine.

```
C:\Users\james_000\Documents\src\atom> .\script\bootstrap
npm 1.4 is required to build Atom. An error (Error: spawn ENOENT) occured when checking the version.
C:\Users\james_000\Documents\src\atom> npm -v
1.4.9
```

After a `script/clean` on my machine, there's no local copy of npm and therefore the npm verification script defaults to `npm`, which for some reason doesn't seem to resolve correctly to the `npm.cmd`. I'm not sure why but that seems to be the behavior I'm seeing.

Using my proposed changes I see:

```
C:\Users\james_000\Documents\src\atom> .\script\bootstrap
Node: v0.10.28
npm: v1.4.9
Python: v2.7.6
```

data.title: Scripts don't seem to do anything on Ubuntu 13.10
data.body: I'm running **Ubuntu 13.10** and all the scripts in the _scripts/_ directory seem to do nothing.  No errors, no output.  Nothing.  No files are created either, I am very confused.

data.title: Package manager not accessing the API
data.body: just finished building Atom from source on linux and when i install any package/theme/ui whatever it returns a 400 after a few seconds saying the repo is inaccessable. after following the link that it gives me, it still returns the same message, is the server API down or something?

data.title: Remove package from disablePackages when it is uninstalled
data.body:
If a package is uninstalled while disabled, its entry in 'disabledPackages' is left behind. It should probably be deleted.

Similarly, any config for the package being removed is also left in `config.cson`. There is possibly more of a reason to leave this behind (don't want to nuke the user's settings), but deletion of these should maybe also be considered.

Not a huge deal, just something I noticed.

data.title: Windows 7 crashes on 0.102.0 build
Show all invisible characters
data.body:
Is there a way to get Atom to apply the `invisible-character` class to _all_ invisible spaces, instead of just those at the start and end of the line?

Tabs are shown anywhere on the line, but spaces are only shown at the start and end.

data.title: Change line commenting to uncomment if all non-blank lines are commented out
data.body:
Fixes #2526

This slightly alters the heuristic for deciding whether to uncomment or to comment blocks of code. Previously, it would key off the first line of code and only if that was commented would it check the other lines. Now it checks all lines of code and uncomments the block if all non-blank lines are commented out.

data.title: Scrollbar Style on Mac OSX
data.body: After changing the theme, the scrollbars in the editor and tree view go to the theme's style, but after reloading the editor they go to the default white OSX style.

data.title: Slow the scroll speed
data.body:
Folks have been complaining about the mousewheel scroll speed -- it's too fast. It is really really sensitive. Turns out the deltas from the mousewheel event are generally regarded as [too fast](https://github.com/brandonaaron/jquery-mousewheel/issues/36). 

In my tests, the browser scroll speed is somewhere between 30 and 40% of atom's scroll speed. So I've slowed it down by that much. It feels way better. 

[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/DOM/DOM_event_reference/mousewheel) says the values are different depending on system and attached mouse. Anyone have an actual windows machine they can test this out on? @kevinsawicki are you using a real windows machine?

It is an option called `editor.scrollSensitivity`. Not sure what the units should be. I have it as a percentage of the original value, so the default is 40. It depends on what this feels like on windows.

Refs #1906

data.title: Reloading spec window with inspector open pauses
data.body:
1. Run some specs (I was running the core specs)
2. Open the inspector
3. Reload the spec window

It pauses execution. It's super frustrating as I am often trying to debug something with the inspector open. Now my flow sucks: refresh, ugh it's paused, oops the inspector is open, close inspector, open inspector again when it loads, click console tab. 

This might be an atom-shell thing?

data.title: Add classic copy/paste to Linux and Win32 keymaps
data.body:
For issue:  "Paste via Shift+Insert not working (Windows)" #2546
This has been added to the linux and win32 keymaps.

:memo: 

```
Ctrl+Insert: Copy
Shift+Insert: Paste
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3217351/9eef6c88-efde-11e3-9e26-3e04d7b06bac.png)

data.title: Detab deletes text if there is a tab used for alignment
Open files only when they exist
data.body:
Hello,

I'm writing an extension and I need to open one of two files, depending on if the first one exists or not.

Currently I'm synchronously testing if the first exists, then testing if the second exists, and if one exists I'm opening with `workspaceView.open` (which is actually [`workspace.open`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/workspace.coffee#L81-L115). 

I image that  other developers might also enjoy this option. Any chance of having this implemented? I can write the patch myself if is interesting for you.

data.title: focus undefined
Feature: additional key binding for copy-paste
data.body:
Please add additional key combinations to default key bindings for copy-paste like:

Copy: CTRL + INS,
Paste: SHIFT + INS

I think many people use this keys combinations.

data.title: Atom suddenly not launching anymore
data.body:
Windows 8.1

So I built it just yesterday, and after initial hiccups it built successfully and launched fine. Ran it a few times, used it for a few code files to play around, and then also installed one or two packages (javascript-related code completion etc).

Now, out of nowhere, it won't launch an editor window anymore. It opens partially in the task bar:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3209965/6f2dc794-ee97-11e3-8ccb-098b5b5d2879.png)

But no actual window opens, no matter how often I click on the partial snippet in the task bar, or alt-tab to it.

And if I try to run it from command line, I get this error:

> [11128:0607/235050:ERROR:crash_reporter_win.cc(69)] Cannot initialize out-of-process crash handler"

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3209955/ea9c4780-ee96-11e3-842d-0c448624ce44.png)

I suppose I'll have to re-build it, which will probably fix this. I just wanted to log the issue.

Update: I have just rebuilt it from scratch. Still the same issue.
I suppose that points at something outside of Atom being wrong.

data.title: Treeview toggle not working when first opened
data.body:
Windows 8.1

Every time I open atom (without passing any location or file to open), it opens up with an empty editor pane as expected. 

But when I press Ctrl-\ the tree view does not open.
If I go to "Toggle Tree View" from the menu, it also does nothing, no matter how often I click it or hit the key binding.

Only after opening a new window, e.g. by opening a folder or file via the menu, does the toggling work again and the tree view responds.

data.title: beginning/end of word keybinding doesn't handle camelCase
data.body: I used Sublime before and I remember being able to shift between words and in between words if there wereAnyCamelCase it would stop at each word.  Is there a separate key binding for this or is this a bug?

data.title: feature request: right-clicking anywhere in text should offer cut, copy & paste in addition to contextual packages
data.body:
hi,

this is a feature request for the basic Atom editor.

**Set-up** —

Atom 0.101.0 on an iMac 27" with intel core i7 processor, 16 GB of RAM & Mac OS X 10.9.3 Mavericks with all current updates.

**Expected Behavior —**

When you right-click (or ctrl-click on Mac OS X also) in any place that can take text input, in the contextual menu that comes up, addition to seeing a listing of contextual add-on Atom packages offered, you should have contextual cut-copy-paste in the menu.

**Observed Behavior —**

Instead, you just see the contextual menu of packages currently available, as in this screen shot —
![screen shot 2014-06-07 at 11 58 00 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/398378/3209602/12c472d2-ee79-11e3-95f3-86a8d5e4b976.png)

**Suggested Behavior —**

Add contextual cut, copy & paste to the right-click (ctrl-click) menu.

best,

—  faddah wolf
     portland, oregon, u.s.a.
     github.com/faddah
